channel.title: builtin on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in builtin on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Vulnerable Netlogon Secure Channel Connection Allowed
item.description: Detects that a vulnerable Netlogon secure channel connection was allowed, which could be an indicator of CVE-2020-1472.

item.title: File Was Not Allowed To Run
item.description: Detect run not allowed files. Applocker is a very useful tool, especially on servers where unprivileged users have access. For example terminal servers. You need configure applocker and log collect to receive these events.

item.title: Denied Access To Remote Desktop
item.description: This event is generated when an authenticated user who is not allowed to log on remotely attempts to connect to this computer through Remote Desktop. Often, this event can be generated by attackers when searching for available windows servers in the network.

item.title: Potential Remote Desktop Connection to Non-Domain Host
item.description: Detects logons using NTLM to hosts that are potentially not part of the domain.

item.title: Enumeration via the Global Catalog
item.description: Detects enumeration of the global catalog (that can be performed using BloodHound or others AD reconnaissance tools). Adjust Treshhold according to domain width.

item.title: Suspicious LDAP-Attributes Used
item.description: Detects the usage of particular AttributeLDAPDisplayNames, which are known for data exchange via LDAP by the tool LDAPFragger and are additionally not commonly used in companies.

item.title: CVE-2020-0688 Exploitation via Eventlog
item.description: Detects the exploitation of Microsoft Exchange vulnerability as described in CVE-2020-0688

item.title: Malicious Service Installations
item.description: Detects known malicious service installs that only appear in cases of lateral movement, credential dumping and other suspicious activity

item.title: Audit CVE Event
item.description: Detects events generated by Windows to indicate the exploitation of a known vulnerability (e.g. CVE-2020-0601)

item.title: External Disk Drive or USB Storage Device
item.description: Detects external diskdrives or plugged in USB devices

item.title: RottenPotato Like Attack Pattern
item.description: Detects logon events that have characteristics of events generated during an attack with RottenPotato and the like

item.title: DPAPI Domain Backup Key Extraction
item.description: Detects tools extracting LSA secret DPAPI domain backup key from Domain Controllers

item.title: DPAPI Domain Master Key Backup Attempt
item.description: Detects anyone attempting a backup for the DPAPI Master Key. This events gets generated at the source and not the Domain Controller.

item.title: LSASS Access from Non System Account
item.description: Detects potential mimikatz-like tools accessing LSASS from non system account

item.title: Protected Storage Service Access
item.description: Detects access to a protected_storage service over the network. Potential abuse of DPAPI to extract domain backup keys from Domain Controllers

item.title: SAM Registry Hive Handle Request
item.description: Detects handles requested to SAM registry hive

item.title: Suspicious Windows ANONYMOUS LOGON Local Account Created
item.description: Detects the creation of suspicious accounts simliar to ANONYMOUS LOGON, such as using additional spaces. Created as an covering detection for exclusion of Logon Type 3 from ANONYMOUS LOGON accounts.

item.title: New or Renamed User Account with '$' in Attribute 'SamAccountName'.
item.description: Detects possible bypass EDR and SIEM via abnormal user account name.

item.title: Possible DC Shadow
item.description: Detects DCShadow via create new SPN

item.title: Suspicious Outbound Kerberos Connection
item.description: Detects suspicious outbound network activity via kerberos default port indicating possible lateral movement or first stage PrivEsc via delegation.

item.title: Tap Driver Installation
item.description: Well-known TAP software installation. Possible preparation for data exfiltration using tunnelling techniques

item.title: Remote PowerShell Sessions
item.description: Detects basic PowerShell Remoting by monitoring for network inbound connections to ports 5985 OR 5986

item.title: AD Object WriteDAC Access
item.description: Detects WRITE_DAC access to a domain object

item.title: SCM Database Handle Failure
item.description: Detects non-system users failing to get a handle of the SCM database.

item.title: SCM Database Privileged Operation
item.description: Detects non-system users performing privileged operation os the SCM database

item.title: SysKey Registry Keys Access
item.description: Detects handle requests and access operations to specific registry keys to calculate the SysKey

item.title: Hacktool Ruler
item.description: This events that are generated when using the hacktool Ruler by Sensepost

item.title: Potential RDP Exploit CVE-2019-0708
item.description: Detect suspicious error on protocol RDP, potential CVE-2019-0708

item.title: Local User Creation
item.description: Detects local user creation on windows servers, which shouldn’t happen in an Active Directory environment. Apply this Sigma Use Case on your windows server logs and not on your DC logs.

item.title: MSHTA Suspicious Execution 01
item.description: Detection for mshta.exe suspicious execution patterns sometimes involving file polyglotism

item.title: RDP over Reverse SSH Tunnel WFP
item.description: Detects svchost hosting RDP termsvcs communicating with the loopback address

item.title: RDP Login from Localhost
item.description: RDP login with localhost source address may be a tunnelled login

item.title: Turla PNG Dropper Service
item.description: This method detects malicious services mentioned in Turla PNG dropper report by NCC Group in November 2018

item.title: LSASS Access Detected via Attack Surface Reduction
item.description: Detects Access to LSASS Process

item.title: smbexec.py Service Installation
item.description: Detects the use of smbexec.py tool by detecting a specific service installation

item.title: NetNTLM Downgrade Attack
item.description: Detects NetNTLM downgrade attack

item.title: Successful Overpass the Hash Attempt
item.description: Detects successful logon with logon type 9 (NewCredentials) which matches the Overpass the Hash behavior of e.g Mimikatz’s sekurlsa::pth module.

item.title: Disabling Windows Event Auditing
item.description: Detects scenarios where system auditing (ie: windows event log auditing) is disabled. This may be used in a scenario where an entity would want to bypass local logging to evade detection when windows event logging is enabled and reviewed. Also, it is recommended to turn off “Local Group Policy Object Processing” via GPO, which will make sure that Active Directory GPOs take precedence over local/edited computer policies via something such as “gpedit.msc”. Please note, that disabling “Local Group Policy Object Processing” may cause an issue in scenarios of one off specific GPO modifications – however it is recommended to perform these modifications in Active Directory anyways.

item.title: Admin User Remote Logon
item.description: Detect remote login by Administrator user depending on internal pattern

item.title: Secure Deletion with SDelete
item.description: Detects renaming of file while deletion with SDelete tool

item.title: WCE wceaux.dll Access
item.description: Detects wceaux.dll access while WCE pass-the-hash remote command execution on source host

item.title: DHCP Server Error Failed Loading the CallOut DLL
item.description: This rule detects a DHCP server error in which a specified Callout DLL (in registry) could not be loaded

item.title: DHCP Server Loaded the CallOut DLL
item.description: This rule detects a DHCP server in which a specified Callout DLL (in registry) was loaded

item.title: Backup Catalog Deleted
item.description: Detects backup catalog deletions

item.title: Turla Service Install
item.description: This method detects a service install of malicious services mentioned in Carbon Paper - Turla report by ESET

item.title: SAM Dump to AppData
item.description: Detects suspicious SAM dump activity as cause by QuarksPwDump and other password dumpers

item.title: Interactive Logon to Server Systems
item.description: Detects interactive console logons to Server Systems

item.title: Access to ADMIN$ Share
item.description: Detects access to $ADMIN share

item.title: Password Change on Directory Service Restore Mode (DSRM) Account
item.description: The Directory Service Restore Mode (DSRM) account is a local administrator account on Domain Controllers. Attackers may change the password to gain persistence.

item.title: Kerberos Manipulation
item.description: This method triggers on rare Kerberos Failure Codes caused by manipulations of Kerberos messages

item.title: Password Dumper Activity on LSASS
item.description: Detects process handle on LSASS process with certain access mask and object type SAM_DOMAIN

item.title: Failed Logins with Different Accounts from Single Source System
item.description: Detects suspicious failed logins with different user accounts from a single source system

item.title: Mimikatz Use
item.description: This method detects mimikatz keywords in different Eventlogs (some of them only appear in older Mimikatz version that are however still used by different threat groups)

item.title: Relevant Anti-Virus Event
item.description: This detection method points out highly relevant Antivirus events

item.title: Account Tampering - Suspicious Failed Logon Reasons
item.description: This method uses uncommon error codes on failed logons to determine suspicious activity and tampering with accounts that have been disabled or somehow restricted.

item.title: Eventlog Cleared
item.description: One of the Windows Eventlogs has been cleared. e.g. caused by “wevtutil cl” command execution

item.title: Security Eventlog Cleared
item.description: Some threat groups tend to delete the local ‘Security’ Eventlog using certain utitlities

item.title: AD Privileged Users or Groups Reconnaissance
item.description: Detect priv users or groups recon based on 4661 eventid and known privileged users or groups SIDs

item.title: Addition of Domain Trusts
item.description: Addition of domains is seldom and should be verified for legitimacy.

item.title: COMPlus_ETWEnabled Registry Modification
item.description: Potential adversaries stopping ETW providers recording loaded .NET assemblies.

item.title: DNS Server Error Failed Loading the ServerLevelPluginDLL
item.description: This rule detects a DNS server error in which a specified plugin DLL (in registry) could not be loaded

item.title: Enabled User Right in AD to Control User Objects
item.description: Detects scenario where if a user is assigned the SeEnableDelegationPrivilege right in Active Directory it would allow control of other AD user objects.

item.title: Failed Code Integrity Checks
item.description: Code integrity failures may indicate tampered executables.

item.title: First Time Seen Remote Named Pipe
item.description: This detection excludes known namped pipes accessible remotely and notify on newly observed ones, may help to detect lateral movement and remote exec using named pipes

item.title: Generic Password Dumper Activity on LSASS
item.description: Detects process handle on LSASS process with certain access mask

item.title: Login with WMI
item.description: Detection of logins performed with WMI

item.title: Metasploit SMB Authentication
item.description: Alerts on Metasploit host’s authentications on the domain.

item.title: Microsoft Malware Protection Engine Crash
item.description: This rule detects a suspicious crash of the Microsoft Malware Protection Engine

item.title: MMC20 Lateral Movement
item.description: Detects MMC20.Application Lateral Movement; specifically looks for the spawning of the parent MMC.exe with a command line of “-Embedding” as a child of svchost.exe

item.title: NTLM Logon
item.description: Detects logons using NTLM, which could be caused by a legacy source or attackers

item.title: Persistence and Execution at Scale via GPO Scheduled Task
item.description: Detect lateral movement using GPO scheduled task, usually used to deploy ransomware at scale

item.title: Possible Impacket SecretDump Remote Activity
item.description: Detect AD credential dumping using impacket secretdump HKTL

item.title: Powerview Add-DomainObjectAcl DCSync AD Extend Right
item.description: backdooring domain object to grant the rights associated with DCSync to a regular user or machine account using Powerview\Add-DomainObjectAcl DCSync Extended Right cmdlet, will allow to re-obtain the pwd hashes of any user/computer

item.title: QuarksPwDump Clearing Access History
item.description: Detects QuarksPwDump clearing access history in hive

item.title: Remote Registry Management Using Reg Utility
item.description: Remote registry management using REG utility from non-admin workstation

item.title: Remote Service Activity via SVCCTL Named Pipe
item.description: Detects remote service activity via remote access to the svcctl named pipe

item.title: Remote Task Creation via ATSVC Named Pipe
item.description: Detects remote task creation via at.exe or API interacting with ATSVC namedpipe

item.title: Scanner PoC for CVE-2019-0708 RDP RCE Vuln
item.description: Detects the use of a scanner by zerosum0x0 that discovers targets vulnerable to CVE-2019-0708 RDP RCE aka BlueKeep

item.title: StoneDrill Service Install
item.description: This method detects a service install of the malicious Microsoft Network Realtime Inspection Service service described in StoneDrill report by Kaspersky

item.title: Suspicious Access to Sensitive File Extensions
item.description: Detects known sensitive file extensions accessed on a network share

item.title: Suspicious Driver Loaded By User
item.description: Detects the loading of drivers via ‘SeLoadDriverPrivilege’ required to load or unload a device driver. With this privilege, the user can dynamically load and unload device drivers or other code in to kernel mode. This user right does not apply to Plug and Play device drivers. If you exclude privileged users/admins and processes, which are allowed to do so, you are maybe left with bad programs trying to load malicious kernel drivers. This will detect Ghost-In-The-Logs (https://github.com/bats3c/Ghost-In-The-Logs) and the usage of Sysinternals and various other tools. So you have to work with a whitelist to find the bad stuff.

item.title: Suspicious PsExec Execution
item.description: detects execution of psexec or paexec with renamed service name, this rule helps to filter out the noise if psexec is used for legit purposes or if attacker uses a different psexec client other than sysinternal one

item.title: Transfering Files with Credential Data via Network Shares
item.description: Transfering files with well-known filenames (sensitive files with credential data) using network shares

item.title: USB Device Plugged
item.description: Detects plugged USB devices
